project.name: Orion Edge Gateway
project.scope: API gateway, rate limiting, auth integration

sections.title: Project Overview & Objectives
sections.goal: Understand the high-level goals, customer needs, and success criteria for Orion Edge Gateway.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the primary business problem Orion Edge Gateway is aiming to solve?
How do you define success for the Build phase in relation to the SLA-ORI-02 p95 latency target?
What are the key customer segments and their most critical use cases?

sections.title: SLA Alignment & Operational Constraints
sections.goal: Explore how the project aligns with organizational SLAs, policies, and operational requirements.
sample_questions: How are you ensuring compliance with 'POL-SEC-001 Least Privilege & JIT Access' during development?
What measures are in place to meet SLA-ORI-02 and how will you validate them?
Can you describe any dependencies on other projects like Poseidon Networking for mTLS?

sections.title: Integration & Cross-Team Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify non-trivial dependencies across subsystems and departments.
sample_questions: How does Orion Edge Gateway integrate with Aegis IAM for authentication?
Are there shared runbooks or RFCs that guide integration points with Nimbus Observability?
What coordination mechanisms exist with the SRE and Security teams?

sections.title: Risk Management & Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Discuss key risks, tradeoffs made during design, and mitigation plans.
sample_questions: What’s the most significant tradeoff you’ve made between feature delivery speed and SLA compliance?
Can you give an example of a risk identified in a ticket, like GW-4821, and how it was addressed?
How do you balance rate limiting policies with customer experience?

sections.title: Evidence & Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Assess how decisions are backed by evidence and how learnings are fed back into the process.
sample_questions: What metrics or analytics are you collecting to inform future RFCs?
How often do you revisit runbooks like RB-GW-011 to ensure they’re up to date?
Can you share an example where post-incident analysis led to a change in process?
